oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Henry L. Douglass, 1981 November 11, excerpt 05
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville doctor and urologist Henry L. Douglass, conducted on 11 November 1981 by Ophelia Paine as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. 1910-1935 Oral History Project. Douglass discusses the street cars in Nashville during the early 1900s and how it was so noisy on Eighth Avenue that he could hardly examine patients. The complete interview, as well an index, is available in the Special Collections Division.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Douglass, Henry L., 1891-1990--Interviews
